ALARM_SETTINGS_EMAIL_BCC_LABEL: Put destination emails in the BCC list rather than To list
ALARM_SETTINGS_EMAIL_BCC_NOTE: By default the destination email addresses are put in the To list and will be visible to every recipient, use this option to add them to the BCC list instead
ALARM_SETTINGS_EMAIL_HTML_NOTE: By default the email messages use UTF-8 plain text, but you can define your own in strings.ini and use HTML if you wish
AUTOMATED_READINGS_DESC: Adds an automated reading to the database from the above sensor at the snow reading time. This only creates the record if a manual record has not already been created.
CHART_HIST_CHILL_HRS_DESC: Line chart showing daily increments to the annual chill hours. These values increase over the year, the year normally starts in October for the northern hemisphere, and April in the southern.
CHART_HIST_GDD_DESC: Line chart showing daily increments to growing degree days. These values increase over the growing year, the year normally starts in January for the northern hemisphere, and July in the southern. Two ranges are defined for each year: range one incrementing when the temperature is above 5°C or 40°F, and range two incrementing when the temperature is above 10°C or 50°F. Though the station owner can override these values and define their own.
CHART_HIST_HUM_DESC: Line chart showing daily high and low relative humidity values.
CHART_HIST_RAIN_DESC: Bar chart showing daily rainfall values.
CHART_HIST_SOLAR_DESC: Combination line and bar chart showing daily high solar irradiation and sunshine hours.
CHART_HIST_SNOW_DESC: Chart showing daily snow depth and last 24 hours snowfall.
CHART_HIST_TEMP_DESC: Line chart showing daily temperature values. Shown are the maximum, minimum, and average temperatures for each day along with many possible derived temperature values. The site owner may choose to not display all these values
CHART_HIST_TEMPSUM_DESC: Line chart showing daily increments to the annual temperature sum. These values increase over the year, the year normally starts in January for the northern hemisphere, and July in the southern. Three ranges are defined for each year: The ranges being measured relative to the base temperatures of; 0°C/32°F, 5°C/40°F, and 10°C/50°F respectively. Though the station owner can override these values and define their own.
CHART_HIST_WIND_DESC: Line chart showing daily high gust, high average wind speed, and daily wind run values.
CHART_RECENT_AQ_DESC: Line chart showing recent air bourne particulate matter concentrations at a one minute resolution. Air quality is typically measured using two particulate sizes of 2.5 microns and 10 microns.
CHART_RECENT_CO2_DESC: Line chart showing recent carbon dioxide sensor values at a one minute resolution. Typically these sensors only provide meaningful data indoors. This sensor may also show particulate matter, temperature and humidity values.
CHART_RECENT_DAILYRAIN_DESC: Bar chart showing recent daily rainfall values.
CHART_RECENT_DAILYTEMP_DESC: Line chart showing recent daily temperature values. Shown are the maximum, minimum, and average temperatures for each day. The site owner may choose to not display all these values.
CHART_RECENT_EXTRADEW_DESC: Line chart showing recent additional dew point sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors are unique to the station and placed to suit the station requirements.
CHART_RECENT_EXTRAHUM_DESC: Line chart showing recent additional humidity sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors are unique to the station and placed to suit the station requirements.
CHART_RECENT_EXTRATEMP_DESC: Line chart showing recent additional temperature sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors can display any sort of data from pool temperatures to freezer temperatures depending on station usage.
CHART_RECENT_HUM_DESC: Line chart showing outdoor (and optionally indoor) relative humidity at a one minute resolution.
CHART_RECENT_LEAFWET_DESC: Line chart showing recent leaf wetness sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors are unique to the station and placed to suit the station requirements.
CHART_RECENT_PRESS_DESC: Line chart showing recent pressure values at a one minute resolution.
CHART_RECENT_RAIN_DESC: Line chart showing the cumulative daily rainfall and rainfall rate at a one minute resolution
CHART_RECENT_SOILMOIST_DESC: Line chart showing recent soil moisture sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors are unique to the station and placed at depths to suit the station requirements.
CHART_RECENT_SOILTEMP_DESC: Line chart showing recent soil tempertaure sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors are unique to the station and placed at depths to suit the station requirements.
CHART_RECENT_SOLAR_DESC: Line chart showing recent solar irradiation and UV index values at a one minute resolution. This station may not have both sensors. For comparision the chart also shows the calculated theoretical solar value.
CHART_RECENT_SUNSHOURS_DESC: Bar chart showing recent daily sunshine hours values.
CHART_RECENT_TEMP_DESC: Line chart showing recent temperature and various derived temperature values at a one minute resolution.
CHART_RECENT_USERTEMP_DESC: Line chart showing recent additional temperature sensor values at a one minute resolution. These sensors can display any sort of data from pool temperatures to freezer temperatures depending on station usage.
CHART_RECENT_WIND_DESC: Line chart showing recent average wind speed and gust values at a one minute resolution.
CHART_RECENT_WINDDIR_DESC: Scatter chart showing recent wind bearing spot and average values at a one minute resolution.
CLICK_UPDATE_TO_REFRESH: Click the 'Update' button to refresh the result.
COMPARISON_CHARTS_DESC: The Select-a-chart allows you to configure your own graph to compare values together. Up to six different data values can be selected using the drop-down selectors below the graph. Each data value has a further drop-down selector to change the colour for that particular data plot.
CURRENT_CONDITIONS_DESC: Text to display - Note new lines will be replaced by spaces
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_ROOT: Filename Root: This string is used to create the full log filename. It will be appended with the date, and suffixed with .txt
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_ROOT_NOTE1: For example, you enter 'MyLog', the interval log filename will be MyLog-yyyyMM.txt, the daily log would just be MyLog.txt
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_DATA: Data Content: This string is used to create the data in the log file, you use webtags to specify the data.
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_DATA_NOTE1: Your data string will be automatically prefixed with the date or date-time in the log file.
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_EXAMPLE1: For example you could use the string: <#temp><#hum><#SoilTemp1>
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_EXAMPLE2: You can also use modifiers in the webtags for further control of the output like this: <#temp rc=y><#hum><#SoilTemp1 dp=2 rc=y>
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_EXAMPLE3: You MUST use the rc=y web tag parameter for numeric values if your locale uses a comma decimal
CUSTOM_LOG_SETTINGS_NOTE1: Note: It is important to use a comma ',' as the field separator as CMX will only recognise this format.
DELETE_ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure you want to delete this record?
DRY/WET_PERIOD_NOTE: Note the longest dry/wet periods exclude days outside your date range so may not be accurate
EMAIL_TO_NOTE: Separate multiple email addresses with a semicolon ';'. Eg: joe@somewhere.com; jane@here.net
ERROR_SELECT_DATE: Error: You must select a date first.
ERROR_SELECT_FILE: Error; You must select a file to upload first!
EXTRA_WEB_FILES_NOTE1: Note that you can use replacable values in both the source and target file fields for Cumulus files that change their name periodically. The allowed values are:
EXTRA_WEB_FILES_NOTE3: The tagged value will be replaced by the current logs file name.
EXTRA_WEB_FILES_NOTE4: The Incremental setting is only used by PHP uploads. It is for incrementally uploading log files that grow a line at a time.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_URL1: URL: This the url used to access your source file.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_URL2: This can be either a URL or <ecowittcameraurl>, in which case the latest Ecowitt web cam image will be downloaded (if available). URLs can contain web tags
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_DEST1: Destination Filename: This the path and file name where you want your downloaded file to be saved.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_DEST2: This is either a path on your web server, or a local path where Cumulus is running - the Upload Enabled option controls which.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_DOWN1: Download Interval: This a multiple of your web interval, or at the End of Day rollover
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_DOWN2: For example, if your web interval is 5 minutes and you select 'x12', then the download will occur once an hour.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_UP1: Upload Enabled: This controls if the file is just downloaded to the local file system, or it is then uploaded to your web site.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_TIMED1: Timed Downloads: If this is disabled, then the file will be downloaded at the set interval, starting whenever Cumulus is started.
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_TIMED2: If you enable this option, then the downloads will start at First Download and repeat each interval
HTTP_FILE_SETTINGS_FIRST1: First Download: If timed uploads are enabled, then the first download of the day will occur at this time and repeat at each interval until the end of the day
LATEST_ERRORS_TEXT1: Displays the latest errors recorded by Cumulus. The log content auto refreshes every 20 seconds.
MQTT_SETTINGS_NOTE1: Note: Saving the settings, even without changing anything will cause Cumulus to re-read your template files.
MQTT_SETTINGS_NOTE2: Changing the server settings requires a restart of Cumulus to take effect.
MYSQL_SETTINGS_UPDATE_NOTE: Note, this will add missing columns to the table, but it will not update existing columns
NAME: Name
NO_SENSORS_ENABLED_DESC: No sensors enabled. Enable in: Settings|Display Options|Graphs|Data Visibility
NOAA_REPORTS_NOTE: Note that reports created with a different UTF-8 format option than current will not display the degree symbol correctly
NOT_VALID_API_KEY: That is not a valid API Key!
NOT_VALID_APP_KEY: That is not a valid Application Key!
NOT_VALID_EMEI: That is not a valid IMEI!
NOT_VALID_MAC: That is not a valid MAC address!
NOT_VALID_URL: That is not a valid URL!
PATH_MUST_END_WITH_DELIM: The path must end with a path delimiter [\\ or /]
PLEASE_ENTER_VALID_DECIMAL: Please enter a valid decimal value
PLEASE_ENTER_VALUE_180_180_DEGREES: Please enter a value between -180.0 and +180.0 degrees
PLEASE_ENTER_VALUE_90_90_DEGREES: Please enter a value between -90.0 and +90.0 degrees
PURGE_MYSQL_TEXT1: Edit or purge the failed MySQL command queue
PURGE_MYSQL_TEXT2: If you have failed MySQL commands stuck in the upload queue, this page allows you to either delete the entire failed queue, or edit/delete individual entries.
RECORD_BLANK_FIELD: This field is blank, cannot set the record to this!
RECORD_ALREADY_SET: The record is already set to this value!
RECORDS_EDITOR_CAUTION: Caution, if you have lots of data this could be a lengthy process
RECORDS_EDITOR_NOTE: Note: You can click on the Dayfile/Logfile Values/Timestamps to copy the value to your record fields
RELOAD_DAYFILE_TEXT1: Force a reload of the Dayfile back into CMX memory
RELOAD_DAYFILE_TEXT2: You may want to do this if you have bulk edited the dayfile with Cumulus running and do not want to restart it to perform the reload.
SELECTACHART_DESC: The Select-a-Period allows you to configure your own graph to compare values together. You can select start and end dates for the data. Up to six different data values can be selected using the drop-down selectors below the graph. Each data value has a further drop-down selector to change the colour for that particular data plot.
SETTINGS_CHANGED_RESTART: You have changed the program settings, you must restart Cumulus MX for this to take effect
SETTINGS_USE_NOTE: Click on sections marked ▸ to expand them. Click again to collapse the section. Click the  'Save Settings' button to save the settings.
UPLOAD_FILE_ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure you want to upload this file? All existing data will be deleted.
UPLOAD_NOW_TEXT1: Manually initiate the upload/local copy process.
UPLOAD_NOW_TEXT2: Note: The actual upload/copy process will be started, but it will be run as a background process. You will have to check your log files and/or server/destination folder to check whether it worked correctly or not.
UPLOAD_NOW_CB1: Re-upload full copies of the graph data files rather than incremental
UPLOAD_NOW_CB2: Include regenerating and transfer of daily graph data files
UPLOAD_NOW_CB3: Include transfer of latest NOAA report files
UPLOAD_NOW_CB4: Re-upload full copies of all Extra Web Files incremental log files
USER_ALARMS_NAME: Name: A descriptive name for the alarm, this will appear in emails and the diagnostic log.
USER_ALARMS_NAME_NOTE1: The name should be unique and short.
USER_ALARMS_WEBTAG_NOTE1: A single valid numeric or boolean web tag to be tested
USER_ALARMS_WEBTAG_NOTE2: Multiple web tags and the arithmetic operaors: + - * / % (mod)
USER_ALARMS_WEBTAG_NOTE3: If the tag is a decimal value and your locale uses comma decimals, you must use the rc=y web tag option.
USER_ALARMS_WEBTAG_NOTE4: You can use boolean web tags, they are treated as numeric values 0 (false) or 1 (true).
USER_ALARMS_TYPE: Type: Determines if the alarm is triggered if the web tag value is above or below the alarm value.
USER_ALARMS_VALUE: Value: The alarm threshold value to be tested against the web tag value.
USER_ALARMS_EMAIL: Email: Controls if the alarm sends an email when triggered. The email values from the standard alarms are used.
USER_ALARMS_EMAIL_MSG: Email Msg: Text to send in the email, you can use the parameter {0} to represent the current tested web tag value. You can also embed any other web tags in the message.
USER_ALARMS_BLUESKY: Bluesky Template: Path to a Bluesky template file (see Third party uploads for template details) to create a post to Bluesky when the alarm occurs.
USER_ALARMS_BLUESKY_NOTE: Leaving this field blank suppresses the creation of a post.
USER_ALARMS_LATCH: Latch: Controls if the alarm is latched. If latched, the alarm will not be triggered again until the latch hours expire.
USER_ALARMS_LATCH_HOURS: Latch Hours: The number of hours the alarm is latched for.
USER_ALARMS_ACTION: Action: If non-blank, a program or script that is executed when the alarm is triggered.
USER_ALARMS_ACTION_PARAMS: Action Params: Parameters to be passed to the action program or script, the parameters can contain web tags.
WIZARD_DESC: Please fill things in as you wish
